A comma-separated list of names of the columns for Y values.

member.name: T:System.Web.Helpers.Json
member.summary: Provides methods for working with data in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.Json.Decode``1(System.String)
member.summary: Converts data in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format into a strongly typed data list specified by the caller.
member.returns: Returns the JSON-encoded data converted to a strongly typed list.
member.param: The JSON-encoded string to convert.
member.typeparam: The type of the strongly typed list that contains decoded JSON data.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.Json.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts data in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format into a data object.
member.returns: Returns the JSON-encoded data converted to a data object.
member.param: The JSON-encoded string to convert.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.Json.Decode(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Converts data in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format into a data object, allowing the caller to specify the type of the data object.
member.returns: Returns the JSON-encoded data converted to the specified type.
member.param: The JSON-encoded string to convert.
The type that the data should be converted to.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.Json.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a data object to a string in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format.
member.returns: Returns a string of data converted to the JSON format.
member.param: The data object to convert.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.Json.Write(System.Object,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Converts a data object to a string in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format, and adds the string to a object.
member.param: The data object to convert.
The object that contains the converted JSON data.

member.name: T:System.Web.Helpers.ObjectInfo
member.summary: Renders the property names and values of the specified object and any subobjects that it references.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.ObjectInfo.Print(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Renders the property names and values of the specified object and any subobjects that it references.
member.returns: For a simple variable, returns the type and the value. For an object that contains multiple items, returns the property name or key, and the value for each property.
member.param: The object to render information for.
An optional number that specifies the depth of nested subobjects to render information for. The default is 10.
An optional value that specifies the maximum number of characters that the method displays for object values. The default is 1000.
member.exception: is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:System.Web.Helpers.ServerInfo.GetHtml
member.summary: Displays information about the Web server environment.

member.name: T:System.Web.Helpers.SortDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction in which to sort a list of items.

member.name: F:System.Web.Helpers.SortDirection.Ascending
member.summary: Sort from smallest to largest. For example, from A to Z.

member.name: F:System.Web.Helpers.SortDirection.Descending
member.summary: Sort from largest to smallest. For example, from Z to A.

member.name: T:System.Web.Helpers.WebMail
member.summary: Provides a way to construct and send an email message using Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP).

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) is used to encrypt the connection when sending email.
member.returns: true if SSL is used to encrypt the connection; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the email address of the sender.
member.returns: The email address of the sender.

member.name: P:System.Web.Helpers.WebMail.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the sender’s password based on the email account used.

member.summary: Sends the specified message to an SMTP server for delivery.
member.param: The recipients of this email message. Multiple recipients can be specified by separating them using a semicolon (;).
The subject line for the email message.
The body of the email message. If is true, HTML in the body is interpreted as markup.
The email address of the message sender.
The carbon copy (CC) recipients for the email message, if any.
A collection of file names that specifies the files to attach to the email message.
true to specify that the email message body is in HTML format; false to indicate that the body is in plain-text format.
A collection of headers that are sent with this email message.

member.returns: true if credentials are sent with the email message; otherwise, false.
